abstract: As Yahoo’s board decides what to do about Microsoft’s buyout offer, the ax falls for some 1000 Yahoo employees.
snippet: As Yahoo’s board decides what to do about Microsoft’s buyout offer, the ax falls for some 1000 Yahoo employees.
lead_paragraph: These are trying days for everyone at Yahoo — not just for Jerry Yang, the co-founder and chief executive. As Mr. Yang and his board try to keep Microsoft from buying Yahoo — or try to get it to raise its offer before they agree to sell — the ax came down Tuesday on some 1,000 employees.

abstract: The discussions stem from an approach that Yahoo’s bankers made to News Corporation in an effort to find a “white knight” and avoid a hostile takeover by Microsoft.
snippet: The discussions stem from an approach that Yahoo’s bankers made to News Corporation in an effort to find a “white knight” and avoid a hostile takeover by Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo has begun discussions with News Corporation to explore alternatives to Microsoft’s buyout offer, people familiar with the talks said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Yahoo Is Said to Be in Talks With News Corp.

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Miguel Helft

abstract: Dell, the computer maker, said on Tuesday that it would buy the business e-mail services provider MessageOne, which was co-founded by Michael S. Dell’s brother, in an effort to compete with similar services provided by Microsoft and Google.
lead_paragraph: Dell, the computer maker, said on Tuesday that it would buy the business e-mail services provider MessageOne, which was co-founded by Michael S. Dell’s brother, in an effort to compete with similar services provided by Microsoft and Google.

abstract: In the midst of this weekend’s Yahoo hullabaloo, two other bear-hug letters — in addition to the one from Microsoft that we previously wrote about — were delivered to United States-based companies.
lead_paragraph: In the midst of this weekend’s Yahoo hullabaloo, two other bear-hug letters — in addition to the one from Microsoft that we previously wrote about — were delivered to United States-based companies.

abstract: Yahoo is searching for any alternative to being swallowed by Microsoft. It has been talking to News Corporation, Time Warner and Google, among others. None of these talks appear likely to be able to fend off a deal with Microsoft.
snippet: Yahoo is searching for any alternative to being swallowed by Microsoft. It has been talking to News Corporation, Time Warner and Google, among others. None of these talks appear likely to be able to fend off a deal with Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: In the course of a terminal illness, a person will often start to cast about for alternative therapies: herbs, acupuncture, fasting on a Tibetan mountain. This exploration is simply part of the process of coming to terms with the painful truth.

headline.main: A Guide to Yahoo’s Unlikely Alternatives to Microsoft
